intro: Otites densiflorus, commonly known as the denseflower otites, is a flowering plant native to parts of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces clusters of small, yellow to orange flowers. Otites densiflorus typically grows in moist, open habitats such as grasslands and wetlands. Its botanical structure supports its role in local ecosystems, providing nectar for pollinators and seeds for birds and small mammals.
